news_header: Salma al-Shehab, a Saudi PhD student, has been released from prison after her sentence for social media activity was reduced from 34 years to four years.
news_original_title: Saudi PhD student freed after being jailed over posts, activists say
news_text: Salma al-Shehab, a 36-year-old Saudi PhD student at the University of Leeds, was released from prison after her sentence for critical social media posts was reduced. Initially sentenced to 34 years for 'disturbing public order', her sentence was reduced to four years with an additional four years suspended. Activists have called for her full freedom and the right to travel to complete her studies. The case highlights the crackdown on dissent in Saudi Arabia, where many face harsh penalties for peaceful activism.
